attributes.name: VS Code Tips & Tricks
attributes.description: Become a VS Code power user with tips and tricks such as keyboard shortcuts, editing tips and utilizing the goodness of extensions.
attributes.description_plain_text: Become a VS Code power user with tips and tricks such as keyboard shortcuts, editing tips and utilizing the goodness of extensions.

attributes.name: Android Studio Tips and Tricks
attributes.description: Master the hidden gems of Android Studio to improve the speed of your development with these Android Development tips and tricks.
attributes.description_plain_text: Master the hidden gems of Android Studio to improve the speed of your development with these Android Development tips and tricks.

attributes.name: Android Bootcamp
attributes.description: Recordings of live sessions with RW mentors from our Android Bootcamp program.
attributes.contributor_string: Fuad Kamal, Luka Kordić, Filip Babić & Jenn Bailey
attributes.description_plain_text: Recordings of live sessions with RW mentors from our Android Bootcamp program.

attributes.name: iOS Bootcamp
attributes.description: Recordings of live sessions with RW mentors from our iOS Bootcamp program.
attributes.contributor_string: Jay Strawn, Bhagat Singh, Audrey Tam & Jeff Rames
attributes.description_plain_text: Recordings of live sessions with RW mentors from our iOS Bootcamp program.

attributes.name: Reusable iOS Frameworks
attributes.description: If you have found yourself writing the same code over and over again for multiple different apps, then this is the course for you. Learn about the different ways to store your reusable code for a Swift project, how to write methods and functions in a reusable way, and how to think about your end user as a developer rather than a user by focusing on API design principles and access control.
attributes.description_plain_text: If you have found yourself writing the same code over and over again for multiple different apps, then this is the course for you. Learn about the different ways to store your reusable code for a Swift project, how to write methods and functions in a reusable way, and how to think about your end user as a developer rather than a user by focusing on API design principles and access control.

attributes.name: Jetpack Security
attributes.description: Learn how to use the AndroidX Jetpack Security library for managing security keys and encrypting file and preferences data.
attributes.description_plain_text: Learn how to use the AndroidX Jetpack Security library for managing security keys and encrypting file and preferences data.

attributes.name: Android & Flutter Office Hours
attributes.description: Recordings of our Android and Flutter Office Hours, where questions are answered by a panel of experts!
attributes.contributor_string: Harun Wangereka, Libranner Santos, Evana Margain Puig, Brian Kayfitz & Darryl Bayliss
attributes.description_plain_text: Recordings of our Android and Flutter Office Hours, where questions are answered by a panel of experts!

attributes.name: iOS Office Hours
attributes.description: Recordings of our iOS Office Hours, where questions are answered by a panel of experts!
attributes.contributor_string: Libranner Santos, Chuck Krutsinger , Felipe Laso-Marsetti & Scott Gardner
attributes.description_plain_text: Recordings of our iOS Office Hours, where questions are answered by a panel of experts!

attributes.name: Review My Stuff
attributes.description: In these recordings of livestreams, senior members of the raywenderlich.com Team (Marin and Adam) review "stuff" submitted by raywenderlich.com readers! They take a look at the submission, then share what's great about it, and what could be improved.
attributes.description_plain_text: In these recordings of livestreams, senior members of the raywenderlich.com Team (Marin and Adam) review "stuff" submitted by raywenderlich.com readers! They take a look at the submission, then share what's great about it, and what could be improved.

attributes.name: Testing in iOS
attributes.description: Testing is a great way to help ensure the pieces of your app remain functionally correct and bug-free. Explore Unit Testing, UI Testing, Test-Driven Development, and more!
attributes.contributor_string: Christine Sweigart, Jessy Catterwaul & Adriana Kutenko
attributes.description_plain_text: Testing is a great way to help ensure the pieces of your app remain functionally correct and bug-free. Explore Unit Testing, UI Testing, Test-Driven Development, and more!

attributes.name: Beginning Android Debugging
attributes.description: Find out how to debug your Android apps using the many tools available on Android Studio. Learn how to create log statements, add breakpoints to your code, use the Android Studio profiling tools and much more.
attributes.description_plain_text: Find out how to debug your Android apps using the many tools available on Android Studio. Learn how to create log statements, add breakpoints to your code, use the Android Studio profiling tools and much more.

attributes.name: Alamofire
attributes.description: Learn the ins and outs of Alamofire from making requests to uploading files and how to pin certificates. This course uses Alamofire 5.
attributes.description_plain_text: Learn the ins and outs of Alamofire from making requests to uploading files and how to pin certificates. This course uses Alamofire 5.

attributes.name: Beginning Git
attributes.description: In this introduction to using Git for source control you'll learn everything from cloning and creating repos, through committing and ignoring files, to managing remotes and pull requests.
attributes.description_plain_text: In this introduction to using Git for source control you'll learn everything from cloning and creating repos, through committing and ignoring files, to managing remotes and pull requests.

attributes.name: Kotlin Coroutines: Fundamentals
attributes.description: Learn the fundamentals about threads and coroutines, along with the basics of the Kotlin Coroutines framework.
attributes.contributor_string: Katie Collins, Filip Babić & Adriana Kutenko
attributes.description_plain_text: Learn the fundamentals about threads and coroutines, along with the basics of the Kotlin Coroutines framework.

attributes.name: Saving Data in iOS
attributes.description: Find out where and how to save data in iOS! This course explores common methods for persisting user data, all from within Xcode Playgrounds.
attributes.contributor_string: Ehab Yosry Amer, Christine Sweigart, Felipe Laso-Marsetti & Adriana Kutenko
attributes.description_plain_text: Find out where and how to save data in iOS! This course explores common methods for persisting user data, all from within Xcode Playgrounds.

attributes.name: Programming in Kotlin: Functions & Custom Types
attributes.description: Take a deeper look at the Kotlin programming language! Explore the intricacies of functions, lambdas, classes, objects, interfaces, and more.
attributes.contributor_string: Christine Sweigart, Catie Catterwaul & Adriana Kutenko
attributes.description_plain_text: Take a deeper look at the Kotlin programming language! Explore the intricacies of functions, lambdas, classes, objects, interfaces, and more.

attributes.name: Programming in Kotlin: Fundamentals
attributes.description: Learn the fundamental building blocks of Kotlin, through hands-on exercises and challenges! Explore the world of data types, comparison and logical operators, loops, control flow, functions, classes as custom types, and more.
attributes.contributor_string: Filip Babić, Adriana Kutenko & Christine Sweigart
attributes.description_plain_text: Learn the fundamental building blocks of Kotlin, through hands-on exercises and challenges! Explore the world of data types, comparison and logical operators, loops, control flow, functions, classes as custom types, and more.

attributes.name: iPadOS Multitasking
attributes.description: iPadOS Multitasking is new in iOS 13. Learn how to run multiple instances of your app and how to keep the data between these instances in sync. See how to implement state restoration, unique UIs across separate instances, and even drag and drop between two different apps in SwiftUI.
attributes.description_plain_text: iPadOS Multitasking is new in iOS 13. Learn how to run multiple instances of your app and how to keep the data between these instances in sync. See how to implement state restoration, unique UIs across separate instances, and even drag and drop between two different apps in SwiftUI.

attributes.name: Publish to the Google Play Store
attributes.description: Learn how to build a release-ready APK and upload it to the Google Play Store. Along the way, learn how to use the developer console and the guidelines to follow before publishing an app.
attributes.description_plain_text: Learn how to build a release-ready APK and upload it to the Google Play Store. Along the way, learn how to use the developer console and the guidelines to follow before publishing an app.

attributes.name: Kotlin Flow: Getting Started
attributes.description: Kotlin Flow is a new asynchronous stream library from JetBrains, the company behind the Kotlin language. Sharing many similarities with Rx streams, Kotlin Flow is built on top of Kotlin Coroutines. Get started by learning the concepts and usage patterns for the Flow API within IntelliJ IDEA projects. Then, see Flow in action in an Android app. Note: Flow is experimental in Kotlin 1.3 but will likely be stable in Kotlin 1.4.
attributes.description_plain_text: Kotlin Flow is a new asynchronous stream library from JetBrains, the company behind the Kotlin language. Sharing many similarities with Rx streams, Kotlin Flow is built on top of Kotlin Coroutines. Get started by learning the concepts and usage patterns for the Flow API within IntelliJ IDEA projects. Then, see Flow in action in an Android app. Note: Flow is experimental in Kotlin 1.3 but will likely be stable in Kotlin 1.4.

attributes.name: Flutter
attributes.description: Learn multi-platform development with Flutter using our high-quality step-by-step tutorials!

attributes.description: Learn Android development in Kotlin
